position.marginalia_text: In [the] reigne of king Henry VIII. on M. Horne, Doctor Barnes especial frend, hearing that [the] writt shoold uery shortly com to burne him: gaue D[octo]r Barnes counsel, to faine himself desperate; and in that pra[e]tensed case shoold write A Letter to [the] Lord Cardinal Woolsey, & leaue it on his Table, where he lay, & A paper by: to declare whether he was gon to drowne himself, & to leaue his clothes in the same place: leauing there an other Letter to [the] Maoir of [the] towne, search for him in [the] water: bycause he had A Letter written in parchment abowt his neck, inclosed in wax, for Mylorde Cardinal; wi[ch] woold teach all men to beware by him. Whereupon they were VII. dayes in searching for him: but he was warily conueyed to London in A poremans apparrel: and not tarrying there, tooke shipping, & went by long [sease] to Anwerp, & so to Luther: with whome he sooen grew uery great, as also with Melancthon, Pomeran, Just Jonas, Hegendorphinus, and other lerned men: beside [the] Duke of Saxony, & [the] Kinge of Denmark. Immediatly it was towld [the] Cardinal, that D[octo]r Barnes was drowned: who sayed,
